org.strongback.hardware

Class Hardware.Motors

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strongback.hardware.Hardware.Motors
  • Enclosing class:
    Hardware

    public static final class Hardware.Motors
extends Object
    Factory method for different kinds of motors.

    • Method Detail

      • talon

        public static Motor talon(int channel)
        Create a motor driven by a Talon speed controller on the specified channel. The speed output is limited to [-1.0,1.0] inclusive.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel the controller is connected to
        Returns:
        a motor on the specified channel

      • talon

        public static Motor talon(int channel,
                          DoubleToDoubleFunction speedLimiter)
        Create a motor driven by a Talon speed controller on the specified channel, with a custom speed limiting function.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel the controller is connected to
        speedLimiter - function that will be used to limit the speed; may not be null
        Returns:
        a motor on the specified channel

      • jaguar

        public static Motor jaguar(int channel)
        Create a motor driven by a Jaguar speed controller on the specified channel. The speed output is limited to [-1.0,1.0] inclusive.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel the controller is connected to
        Returns:
        a motor on the specified channel

        Returns:

                           DoubleToDoubleFunction speedLimiter)
        Create a motor driven by a Victor speed controller on the specified channel, with a custom speed limiting function
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel the controller is connected to
        speedLimiter - function that will be used to limit the speed (input voltage); may not be null
        Returns:
        a motor on the specified channel

        a motor on the specified channel

      • talonSRX

        public static TalonSRX talonSRX(int deviceNumber)
        Creates a TalonSRX motor controlled by a Talon SRX with no sensors wired as inputs.

        The resulting TalonSRX will have a null TalonSRX.getAnalogInput() and a null TalonSRX.getEncoderInput().

        Parameters:
        deviceNumber - the CAN device number for the Talon SRX; may not be null
        Returns:
        a TalonSRX motor; never null

      • talonSRX

        @Experimental
public static TalonSRX talonSRX(int deviceNumber,
                                              double pulsesPerDegree)
        Creates a TalonSRX motor controlled by a Talon SRX with an optional quadrature encoder and no analog input wired into the Talon.

        The resulting TalonSRX will have a non-null TalonSRX.getEncoderInput() when the pulsesPerDegree is non-zero. But the resulting TalonSRX will always have a null TalonSRX.getAnalogInput().

        Parameters:
        deviceNumber - the CAN device number for the Talon SRX; may not be null
        pulsesPerDegree - the number of encoder pulses per degree of revolution of the final shaft; may be 0 if unused
        Returns:
        a TalonSRX motor; never null

      • talonSRX

        @Experimental
public static TalonSRX talonSRX(int deviceNumber,
                                              double pulsesPerDegree,
                                              double analogTurnsOverVoltageRange)
        Creates a TalonSRX motor controlled by a Talon SRX with an optional quadrature encoder and no an analog 3.3V input wired into the Talon.

        The resulting TalonSRX will have a non-null TalonSRX.getEncoderInput() when the pulsesPerDegree is non-zero. Likewise, the resulting TalonSRX will have a non-null TalonSRX.getAnalogInput() when the analogTurnsOverVoltageRange is non-zero.

        Parameters:
        deviceNumber - the CAN device number for the Talon SRX; may not be null
        pulsesPerDegree - the number of encoder pulses per degree of revolution of the final shaft; may be 0 if unused
        analogTurnsOverVoltageRange - the number of turns of an analog pot or analog encoder over the 0-3.3V range; may be 0 if unused
        Returns:
        a TalonSRX motor; never null

      • talonSRX

        public static TalonSRX talonSRX(CANTalon talon)
        Creates a TalonSRX motor controlled by a Talon SRX. The CANTalon object passed into this method should be already configured by the calling code.

        The resulting TalonSRX will have a null TalonSRX.getEncoderInput() and a null TalonSRX.getAnalogInput(), and the TalonSRX.getSelectedSensor() will always return 0.

        Parameters:
        talon - the already configured CANTalon instance; may not be null
        Returns:
        a TalonSRX motor; never null

      • talonSRX

        @Experimental
public static TalonSRX talonSRX(CANTalon talon,
                                              double pulsesPerDegree)
        Creates a TalonSRX motor controlled by a Talon SRX with an optional (angle) sensor. The CANTalon object passed into this method should be already configured by the calling code.

        The resulting TalonSRX will have a non-null TalonSRX.getEncoderInput() when the pulsesPerDegree is non-zero. But the resulting TalonSRX will always have a null TalonSRX.getAnalogInput().

        Parameters:
        talon - the already configured CANTalon instance; may not be null
        pulsesPerDegree - the number of encoder pulses per degree of revolution of the final shaft
        Returns:
        a TalonSRX motor; never null

      • talonSRX

        @Experimental
public static TalonSRX talonSRX(CANTalon talon,
                                              double pulsesPerDegree,
                                              double analogTurnsOverVoltageRange)
        Creates a TalonSRX motor controlled by a Talon SRX with and optional quadrature encoder and/or an analog 3.3V input wired into the Talon. The CANTalon object passed into this method should be already configured by the calling code.

        The resulting TalonSRX will have a non-null TalonSRX.getEncoderInput() when the pulsesPerDegree is non-zero. Likewise, the resulting TalonSRX will have a non-null TalonSRX.getAnalogInput() when the analogTurnsOverVoltageRange is non-zero.

        Parameters:
        talon - the already configured CANTalon instance; may not be null
        pulsesPerDegree - the number of encoder pulses per degree of revolution of the final shaft
        analogTurnsOverVoltageRange - the number of turns of an analog pot or analog encoder over the 0-3.3V range; may be 0 if unused
        Returns:
        a TalonSRX motor; never null

      • talonSRX

        public static TalonSRX talonSRX(int deviceNumber,
                                TalonSRX leader,
                                boolean reverse)
        Creates a TalonSRX motor controller that follows another Talon SRX. The resulting TalonSRX will have neither a TalonSRX.getAnalogInput() or a TalonSRX.getEncoderInput().
        Parameters:
        deviceNumber - the CAN device number for the Talon SRX; may not be null
        leader - the Talon SRX that is to be followed; may not be null
        reverse - true if the resulting Talon should have inverted output compared to the leader, or false if the output should exactly match the leader
        Returns:
        a TalonSRX motor controller that follows the leader; never null
